logic.impl

Class PollLifecycleBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.impl.PollLifecycleBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PollLifecycleBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An EJB responsible for handling various events in the lifecycle of a poll
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PollLifecycleBean() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelTimer(java.lang.Long pollID, TimerInfo.TimeoutCause cause)
      if a vote is finished prematurely, extendend or cancelled the corresponding timer events have to be cancelled too
      boolean checkIfVoteSuccessful(Poll poll)
      checks if anonymity of voters can be assured this is not the case when participation tracking is enabled and one of the options of any item has all the votes whereas all the others have 0 votes.
      void createReminderTimeout(java.lang.Long pollID, java.util.Date reminderDate)
      creates a timer which keeps track of the reminderDate of its corresponding poll
      void createVoteFinishedTimeout(java.lang.Long pollID, java.util.Date endDate)
      creates a timer which keeps track of the endDate of its corresponding poll
      void createVoteStartedTimeout(java.lang.Long pollID, java.util.Date startDate)
      creates a timer which keeps track of the startDate of its corresponding poll
      void generateTokens(long pollID)
      generates a unique token for each participant
      void handleTimeout(javax.ejb.Timer timer)
      Whenever a timeout is observed the pollID and the cause for the timeout are read from the TimerInfo object of the corresponding timer Here the TimeoutCause Enum is used to indicate the timeout cause : START denotes that the startDate of the poll has come and the poll should be started, REMIND denotes that the reminderDate of the poll has come and END denotes that the endDate of the poll has come.
      void handleVoteFinished(long pollID)
      handler method which is called when the endDate of a vote has come Invalidates all tokens which were not used, sends out a notification email to the organizers and sets the PollState to FINISHED
      void handleVoteRunning(long pollID)
      handler method which is called when the startDate of a vote has come Sets the PollState to RUNNING, generates Tokens and sends out email invitations
      void notifyParticipants(Poll poll) 
      void sendEmailReminders(long pollID)
      sends out email reminders containing the personal tokens to particpants who have not voted yet If participation tracking was enabled for the poll, only those participants are reminded which did not vote yet, otherwise all participants are reminded and only one Email to all has to be sent out.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • handleTimeout

        public void handleTimeout(javax.ejb.Timer timer)
        Whenever a timeout is observed the pollID and the cause for the timeout are read from the TimerInfo object of the corresponding timer Here the TimeoutCause Enum is used to indicate the timeout cause : START denotes that the startDate of the poll has come and the poll should be started, REMIND denotes that the reminderDate of the poll has come and END denotes that the endDate of the poll has come.
        Parameters:
        timer -

      • sendEmailReminders

        public void sendEmailReminders(long pollID)
        sends out email reminders containing the personal tokens to particpants who have not voted yet If participation tracking was enabled for the poll, only those participants are reminded which did not vote yet, otherwise all participants are reminded and only one Email to all has to be sent out.
        Parameters:
